intro: Erysimum hispidum, commonly known as the hispid wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in early spring. Erysimum hispidum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
